page.title: 02Ecology,Turvey
page.content: The area is Grade 3 agricultural land.The soils are heavy clay loams on the boulder clay and light,sandier soils on the alluvium.The area is sensitive to change.Intensive farming has resulted in the loss of hedgerows,trees and meadows in the shift from mixed farming to cereal production.Today,the remaining woodland is of particular landscape and wildlife value and should be conserved and added to in the future.Other pressures may come from gravel extraction from the valley floor and from the fact that the river is vital to water supply and drainage.Works to replace the sluices at Turvey are proposed in the future as part of the Anglian Water Authority's drainage improvement of the Great Ouse.Care will be needed to avoid loss of wildlife and landscape.
